intro: Oxytropis ixodes, commonly known as the redstem locoweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces trifoliate leaves and has a deep taproot system that allows it to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in sagebrush steppe and other dry, open habitats. Oxytropis ixodes is known for its toxic properties, containing alkaloids that can be harmful to livestock.
